articles.headline: Samsung’s Review Phones Fail, Delivering a P.R. Nightmare
articles.snippet: The company said some of the problems described in reviews of its nearly $2,000 Galaxy Fold phone might be due to the removal of a protective film from the display.
articles.abstract: The company said some of the problems described in reviews of its nearly $2,000 Galaxy Fold phone might be due to the removal of a protective film from the display.
articles.lead_paragraph: For Samsung, a tech company that stakes its reputation on shipping flashy new smartphones with eye-catching features, it was a nightmare come true.
articles.byline: By Christine Hauser and Brian X. Chen

articles.headline: Mueller Reveals Trump’s Efforts to Thwart Russian Inquiry in Highly Anticipated Report
articles.snippet: The Mueller team ultimately decided not to charge the president, citing numerous legal and factual constraints, but pointedly declined to exonerate him.
articles.abstract: The Mueller team ultimately decided not to charge the president, citing numerous legal and factual constraints, but pointedly declined to exonerate him.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Robert S. Mueller III revealed the scope of a historic Russian campaign to sabotage the 2016 presidential election in a much-anticipated report made public on Thursday, and he detailed a frantic monthslong effort by President Trump to thwart a federal investigation that imperiled his presidency from the start.

articles.headline: National Enquirer to Be Sold to James Cohen, Heir to Hudson News Founder
articles.snippet: A new buyer for the tabloid swooped in after talks between its publisher, American Media, and the billionaire Ron Burkle fell apart.
articles.abstract: A new buyer for the tabloid swooped in after talks between its publisher, American Media, and the billionaire Ron Burkle fell apart.
articles.lead_paragraph: The National Enquirer, President Trump’s favorite supermarket tabloid, is about to have a new owner: James Cohen, a son of the founder of the Hudson News franchise. American Media Inc., The Enquirer’s publisher, announced the deal Thursday.

articles.headline: A Portrait of the White House and Its Culture of Dishonesty
articles.snippet: At one juncture after another, the Mueller report describes how Mr. Trump made his troubles worse, giving into anger and grievance and lashing out in ways that turned advisers into witnesses against him.
articles.abstract: At one juncture after another, the Mueller report describes how Mr. Trump made his troubles worse, giving into anger and grievance and lashing out in ways that turned advisers into witnesses against him.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — As President Trump met with advisers in the Oval Office in May 2017 to discuss replacements for the F.B.I. director he had just fired, Attorney General Jeff Sessions slipped out of the room to take a call.
articles.byline: By Peter Baker and Maggie Haberman

articles.headline: Democrats Draw Closer to a Dicey Question: Whether to Impeach Trump
articles.snippet: Democrats took the legal analysis in the special counsel’s report as a clear nod that Congress should make its own judgment on obstruction of justice.
articles.abstract: Democrats took the legal analysis in the special counsel’s report as a clear nod that Congress should make its own judgment on obstruction of justice.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — House Democrats, facing some of the most striking evidence yet from Robert S. Mueller III that President Trump attempted to thwart his investigation, edged closer on Thursday to confronting a question they have long tried to avoid: whether the president’s behavior warrants impeachment.

articles.headline: After Social Media Bans, Militant Groups Found Ways to Remain
articles.snippet: Hezbollah and other groups classified as terrorist organizations by the United States have changed their social media strategies to stay on Facebook, YouTube and Twitter.
articles.abstract: Hezbollah and other groups classified as terrorist organizations by the United States have changed their social media strategies to stay on Facebook, YouTube and Twitter.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — In July 2013, a broadcaster affiliated with the Islamist group Hezbollah posted a threatening video on Facebook, YouTube and Twitter. It featured gun-toting militants practicing an ambush to kidnap Israeli soldiers. The message: This is how we kill you.
articles.byline: By Sheera Frenkel and Ben Hubbard

articles.headline: Merger Talks of Deutsche Bank and Commerzbank Roil Emotions
articles.snippet: A proposed deal is meeting resistance from labor, regulators and some shareholders. But there is also political momentum in Germany for a tie-up.
articles.abstract: A proposed deal is meeting resistance from labor, regulators and some shareholders. But there is also political momentum in Germany for a tie-up.
articles.lead_paragraph: FRANKFURT — If the proposed merger between Deutsche Bank and Commerzbank were a film, it would already be racking up the rotten tomatoes.
articles.byline: By Jack Ewing and Melissa Eddy

articles.headline: Socialist! Capitalist! Economic Systems as Weapons in a War of Words
articles.snippet: The economist Joseph Stiglitz discusses Bernie Sanders, social policy and how we define ourselves — and one another.
articles.abstract: The economist Joseph Stiglitz discusses Bernie Sanders, social policy and how we define ourselves — and one another.
articles.lead_paragraph: Joseph Stiglitz settled into a booth at his favorite diner on the Upper West Side last week with a curious, almost satisfied smile on his face.
